claim: As of the mid-2020s, humanity has entered a gradual 'gentle singularity': digital superintelligence is near, AI takeoff has begun, and breakthroughs will rapidly normalize into routine capabilities worldwide.
explanation: Parts of the claim reflect reality—AI capabilities and adoption have surged, with the 2025 AI Index reporting 78% of companies using AI in 2024 alongside major benchmark gains and large investment—so many breakthroughs do diffuse into products. ([ibm.com](https://www.ibm.com/think/news/stanford-hai-2025-ai-index-report?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [thejournal.com](https://thejournal.com/Articles/2025/04/09/Stanford-2025-AI-Index-Reports-Surge-in-Adoption-Investment-and-Global-Impact.aspx?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) But expert evidence does not support that “digital superintelligence is near”: large surveys of AI researchers put a 50% chance of systems outperforming humans in all tasks around 2047, with wide uncertainty, not the mid‑2020s. ([arxiv.org](https://arxiv.org/abs/2401.02843?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [wiki.aiimpacts.org](https://wiki.aiimpacts.org/ai_timelines/predictions_of_human-level_ai_timelines/ai_timeline_surveys/2023_expert_survey_on_progress_in_ai?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) Reputable sources also stress that AGI/superintelligence remain theoretical and poorly defined today. ([theguardian.com](https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2025/aug/09/its-missing-something-agi-superintelligence-and-a-race-for-the-future?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_general_intelligence?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) Moreover, normalization is not “worldwide”: usage and benefits are uneven—low‑income countries account for <1% of GenAI traffic, and OECD/IMF analyses project or observe widening regional divides in exposure and capability. ([blogs.worldbank.org](https://blogs.worldbank.org/en/digital-development/who-on-earth-is-using-generative-ai-?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [oecd.org](https://www.oecd.org/en/about/news/press-releases/2024/11/generative-ai-set-to-exacerbate-regional-divide-in-oecd-countries-says-first-regional-analysis-on-its-impact-on-local-job-markets.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [elibrary.imf.org](https://www.elibrary.imf.org/view/journals/006/2024/001/article-A001-en.xml?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) Recent commentary even debates a plateau in frontier‑model gains, underscoring remaining uncertainty. ([newyorker.com](https://www.newyorker.com/culture/open-questions/what-if-ai-doesnt-get-much-better-than-this?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) Overall, the statement mixes solid facts about rapid progress with speculative, contested assertions about a present “gentle singularity,” near-term superintelligence, and global ubiquity.
